alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lafayette (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 4:13PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Lafayette and southwestern Columbia Counties, northwestern Webster, northwestern Caddo and northwestern Bossier Parishes through 500 PM CST... At 412 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Belcher, or 18 miles north of Bossier City, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springhill, Benton, Cullen, Plain Dealing, Sarepta, Bradley, Taylor, Belcher, Gilliam, Welcome, Alden Bridge, Rocky Mount, Cavett, State Line and Bolinger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CST for southwestern Arkansas...and northwestern Louisiana.
